intro: Anemonastrum zephyrum, commonly known as the windflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features delicate, feathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and adaptation to harsh environments make it a notable species in its native range.
